author: Purvaja Sawant
title: Agnes of God stands tall amidst protests
text:
Despite a whirlwind of protests, threats of ban and severe opposition, the much-talked-about play, Agnes of God, premiered by Bombay Times, staged its first-ever show at the NCPA on Monday evening.
READ: Shabana Azmi: Qualification should be criteria for FTII chairmanship
Celebrities, who believe in the freedom of expression, came to show their solidarity. First to walk in was Shabana Azmi, who was accompanied by Namrata Goyal. The former was seen having a passionate discussion with Dolly Thakore just before the show. Rahul da Cunha, who has supported the play vehemently on social media, arrived with stand-up comedian Anuvab Pal. Theatre veteran Gerson da Cunha also graced the occasion and spent time with restaurateur Rahul Akerkar.
Starring Mahabanoo Mody-Kotwal, Anahita Uberoi and newcomer Avanti Nagral, the powerful story and heart-wrenching performances gave goose bumps to the audiences. The piece received a standing ovation from them. After the curtains fell, director Kaizaad Kotwal delivered a touching speech about the obstacles they faced during the making of the play, and his poignant tribute to his late grandmother brought tears to the eyes of many.
